tit.e: Imperial Prince Sanehito (in the Heian Period)
Imperial Prince Sanehito (in the Heian Period)
tit.cmt: period を小文字にしました。

sen.j: 実仁親王（さねひとしんのう、延久3年2月10日 (旧暦)（1071年3月14日） - 応徳2年11月8日 (旧暦)（1085年11月27日））は、平安時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Sanehito (March 14, 1071 - November 27, 1085) was a member of the Imperial family in the Heian period.
Imperial Prince Sanehito (March 14, 1071 - November 27, 1085) was a member of the Imperial family during the Heian period.
Imperial Prince Sanehito (March 20, 1071 - December 3, 1085) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 後三条天皇の第二皇子。
sen.e: He was the second Prince of Emperor Gosanjo.
He was the second Prince of Emperor Gosanjo.
He was the second Prince of Emperor Gosanjo.

sen.j: 母は源基平の娘である女御源基子。
sen.e: His mother was MINAMOTO no Kishi (Motoko), who was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor)) and a daughter of MINAMOTO no Motohira.
His mother was MINAMOTO no Kishi (Motoko), who was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court, a consort of an emperor) and a daughter of MINAMOTO no Motohira.
His mother was MINAMOTO no Kishi (Motoko), who was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court, a consort of an emperor) and a daughter of MINAMOTO no Motohira.

sen.j: 異母兄・白河天皇の皇太弟となる。
sen.e: He was the younger brother of Emperor Shirakawa who was heir apparent and the elder brother having a different mother.
He was the younger brother of Emperor Shirakawa who was heir apparent and the elder brother having a different mother.
He was the younger paternal half-brother of Emperor Shirakawa who was heir apparent.
sen.cmt: 異母兄 の表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 同母弟に輔仁親王がいる。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Sukehito was his maternal brother.
Imperial Prince Sukehito was his maternal brother.
Imperial Prince Sukehito was his younger maternal half-brother.
sen.cmt: 同母弟 の表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 父・後三条天皇は、傍流とはいえ藤原北家の血を引く長男の貞仁親王（白河天皇）よりも同家と外戚関係を有しない源基子との子供に皇位継承候補者として期待をかけた。
sen.e: His father Emperor Gosanjo expected that Imperial Prince Sanehito, the son by MINAMOTO no Kishi (Motoko), who was not a maternal relative of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, would be the promising imperial heir rather than his eldest son Imperial Prince Sadahito (who would later become Emperor Shirakawa), who was a descendant from a branch of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

His father Emperor Gosanjo expected that Imperial Prince Sanehito, the son by MINAMOTO no Kishi (Motoko), who was not a maternal relative of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, would be the promising imperial heir rather than his eldest son Imperial Prince Sadahito (who would later become Emperor Shirakawa), who was a descendant from a branch of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

His father Emperor Gosanjo expected that a son born to him and MINAMOTO no Kishi (Motoko), who was not a maternal relative of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, would be the promising imperial heir rather than his eldest son Imperial Prince Sadahito (who would later become Emperor Shirakawa), who was a descendant from a branch of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: そこで延久4年（1072年）に白河天皇即位の際に実仁親王はわずか2歳で皇太弟として立てられた。
sen.e: In the enthronement of Emperor Shirakawa in 1072, Imperial Prince Sanehito was addressed the younger brother of Emperor Shirakawa who was heir apparent, only at age two.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the enthronement of Emperor Shirakawa in 1072, Imperial Prince Sanehito was addressed the younger brother of Emperor Shirakawa who was heir apparent, only at age two.

sen.j: 更に翌年の輔仁親王誕生直後に太上天皇となっていた後三条が重態に陥ると、重ねて実仁親王が即位した後には、輔仁親王を皇太弟とするよう遺言した。
sen.e: In the following year when the Retired Emperor Gosanjo became seriously ill soon after Imperial Prince Sukehito was born, he repeatedly confirmed as his will that Imperial Prince Sukehito would be the younger brother of Emperor Sanehito who was heir apparent after the enthronement of Emperor Sanehito.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the following year when the Retired Emperor Gosanjo became seriously ill soon after Imperial Prince Sukehito was born, he repeatedly confirmed as his will that Imperial Prince Sukehito would be the younger brother of Emperor Sanehito who was heir apparent after the enthronement of Emperor Sanehito.

sen.cmt: confirm as のas を削除しました。

sen.j: 承保2年（1075年）に着袴、承暦2年（1078年）に読書始の儀式、永保2年（1081年）に元服の儀式が行われている。
sen.e: Chakko (ceremony of first-time wearing of a hakama) in 1075, the ceremony of dokushohajime (ceremony of first-time learning) in 1078, and the ceremony of attaining manhood in 1081 were held.

sen.j: 誕生前に外祖父源基平は既に死去しており後見がいなかった。
sen.e: The maternal grandfather MINAMOTO no Motohira had already died before Imperial Prince Sanehito was born, so Imperial Prince Sanehito did not have guardian.

sen.j: しかし、祖母である陽明門院の寵愛を得ていたことから、世間からも「いと清らかなる男」称されて、将来を期待されていた。
sen.e: However, as he won his grandmother Yomeimonin's favor, he became known as "the virtuous man" as a promising person.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, as he won his grandmother Yomeimonin's favor, he became known as "the virtuous man" and as a promising person.

sen.j: しかし、応徳2年に実仁親王は疱瘡により倒れてわずか15歳の若さで急死してしまう。
sen.e: Nevertheless, Imperial Prince Sanehito suddenly died of smallpox in 1085 at an early age of 15.

sen.j: 白河天皇は翌年には父の遺言を無視して実子である善仁親王を皇太子に立ててその日のうちに皇太子への譲位を宣言して堀河天皇を即位させて院政を開始する事になった。
sen.e: In the following year, Emperor Shirakawa disregarded his father's will, making his biological son Imperial Prince Taruhito be an imperial prince; the same day, he abdicated the throne in favor of Imperial Prince Taruhito accordingly and Emperor Horikawa ascended the throne, thus initiating the government by the Retired Emperor Shirakawa.

In the following year, Emperor Shirakawa disregarded his father's will, making his biological son Imperial Prince Taruhito an imperial prince; the same day, he abdicated the throne in favor of Imperial Prince Taruhito accordingly and Emperor Horikawa ascended the throne, thus initiating the government by the Retired Emperor Shirakawa.

In the following year, Emperor Shirakawa disregarded his father's will, making his biological son Imperial Prince Taruhito (who later became Emperor Horikawa) an Imperial Prince; the same day, he abdicated the throne in favor of Imperial Prince Taruhito accordingly and Emperor Horikawa ascended to the throne, thus initiating the government by the Retired Emperor Shirakawa.
sen.cmt: Imperial Prince としました。善仁親王が堀河天皇となることを補足で追加しました。
